articles.title: Girl Scouts file lawsuit against Boy Scouts over name change
articles.description: The Girl Scouts say that by planning to drop ‘Boy’ from its name and allowing girls to join, the Boy Scouts are causing confusion and misleading some into thinking the groups have been merged.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: FBI offering $15,0000 reward in search for missing North Carolina girl
articles.description: An urgent manhunt is underway for 13-year-old Hania Aguilar, who police say was abducted right outside her home on Monday. A witness said that a man dressed in black and wearing a yellow bandana forced her into the family’s vehicle and drove away.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Husband opens up about failure of emergency response in wife’s tragic death
articles.description: Laura Levis was having an asthma attack when she dialed 911 for help— the beginning of what Paul DeMarco calls a series “catastrophic mistakes.”

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Fresh faces on Capitol Hill making history
articles.description: The newest Congress features more than 100 women -- a new record -- among them the first Muslim women: Michigan’s Rashida Tlaib and Minnesota’s Ilhan Omar.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Democrats win House while Republicans keep Senate
articles.description: After picking up 28 seats in the House of Representatives, Democrats will now have subpoena power, giving them the ability to investigate the president. In the Senate, Republicans bucked history with the President’s party gaining seats in a midterm.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Trump: Midterm results ‘very close to complete victory’
articles.description: In a combative 87-minute news conference, the President mocked eight defeated members of his own party who refused to embrace him and lashed out at several members of the media.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Democrats’ new warnings after Sessions firing
articles.description: “Any Attorney General… should not be able to interfere with the Mueller investigation in any way,” Senator Chuck Schumer said today, while Rep. Jerry Nadler tweeted: “Americans must have answers immediately” about Sessions’ departure.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Trump ousts Attorney General Jeff Sessions
articles.description: "At your request, I am submitting my resignation," Sessions wrote to Trump, adding that he was "honored to serve" the president. The announcement — made by the president on Twitter — came the day after the midterm elections.

articles.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC) says he's not worried about Sen. Ted Cruz, but rather he's "concerned" for him as the Democratic candidate Rep. Beto O'Rouke makes a strong election challenge.

articles.author: NBC News Exit Poll Desk
articles.title: Voters who sat out 2016 break strongly for Democrats in 2018
articles.description: About one in 10 U.S. voters casting ballots in today’s midterm elections say they didn’t vote in the 2016 presidential election.
articles.content: NBC News projects that the Democratic Party will take control of the House of Representatives. A party needs to control 218 seats in the House for a majority. Some of the key House races that allowed NBC News to call Democratic control of the House included M… [+200 chars]

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Sen. Graham: Sessions likely out after midterms
articles.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham discusses the midterm election results so far, the likelihood of Attorney General Jeff Sessions keeping his job, and whether he'd be interested in being Attorney General himself.

articles.title: Florida restores voting rights to more than 1 million
articles.description: Florida’s Amendment 4 passed on Tuesday night; advocates estimate it could give 1.5 million people their voting rights back.

articles.title: Apologizing for cover-up, Sioux City Roman Catholic diocese vows to ID priests accused of abuse
articles.description: The Diocese of Sioux City on Tuesday apologized for covering up an Iowa priest's sexual abuse of boys for decades and promised to identify all priests who have faced credible allegations.

articles.author: Lauren Egan
articles.title: Top 10 election night highlights
articles.description: Results, exit polls, long lines at polling places in the 2018 crucial midterms.
articles.content: Lauren Egan reports for NBC News, based in Washington.

articles.title: View full election results
articles.description: Get election results in real-time as NBC News covers state results, exit polls, maps and candidates. View the House estimate, Senate balance and more.

articles.author: Adam Edelman
articles.title: In first flip of night, Dems pick up House seat in Virginia suburbs
articles.description: Democrat Jennifer Wexton has defeated Barbara Comstock, the Republican incumbent, in the race for Virginia's 10th Congressional District, NBC News projects.
articles.content: Democrat Jennifer Wexton has defeated Barbara Comstock, the Republican incumbent, in the race for Virginia's 10th Congressional District, NBC News projects. With 56 percent of the vote tallied, Wexton, a state senator, was beating Comstock 57.9 percent to 42.… [+181 chars]

articles.title: Majority of voters favor strict gun control ahead of midterm elections

articles.author: Ben Kamisar
articles.title: Chuck Todd: Late visits by the president hurt Senate GOP candidates at the polls
articles.description: President Trump barnstormed his way across the country to help GOP Senate candidates mobilize the party's base, but "Meet the Press" host Chuck Todd says those appearances may have done more harm than good.
articles.content: The Florida Senate race between Democratic incumbent Bill Nelson and Republican Rick Scott, the outgoing governor, is too close to call, according to NBC News. Polls closed in Florida at 7:00 p.m. ET. Nelson, who has served in the Senate since 2000, had cruis… [+195 chars]

articles.title: Trump spent day in White House calling friends and allies
articles.description: President Trump has been spending most of Election Day in the White House residence, making calls to allies and friends.

articles.author: NBC News Exit Poll Desk
articles.title: Exit polls: Gender gap among voters over Justice Kavanaugh's confirmation
articles.description: Voters in today's midterm election are more likely to oppose the U.S. Senate’s decision to confirm Brett Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court than they are to support it, according to early NBC News Exit Poll results.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: Brian Kemp struggles to cast vote
articles.description: Brian Kemp, Republican candidate for Governor of Georgia, struggled to cast his vote Tuesday when his card read invalid. Kemp’s campaign said he had a blank card. On second attempt Kemp successfully cast his ballot with his daughter by his side.

articles.author: Tony Capra
articles.title: Georgia voters file lawsuit seeking to block Kemp from overseeing election results
articles.description: A group of voters filed a lawsuit Tuesday in a bid to prevent Secretary of State Brian Kemp from supervising the results in the gubernatorial election, in which he is a candidate.

articles.author: NBCNews.com
articles.title: WATCH NOW: NBC News special election night coverage
articles.description: Live coverage of the 2018 midterm elections has begun on NBC News. On NBC News Signal, watch a one-hour special with Stephanie Ruhle for the latest headlines, takeaways on exit poll data and a look at President Donald Trump's impact on the midterms.
